title: Desert Hazard Avoidance Techniques
brief: Avoid dangerous desert hazards including venomous creatures and hazardous locations.
steps: Step 1: Always wear gloves when in desert environment.
Step 2: Visually inspect any area before sitting or lying down.
Step 3: Look carefully before placing hands anywhere.
Step 4: When getting up, shake out and inspect boots and clothing.
Step 5: Avoid ruins, caves, garbage dumps, and rock outcroppings where snakes shelter.
Step 6: Never walk barefoot or through snake habitat without careful inspection.
Step 7: Give snakes wide berth when encountered - do not attempt to handle.
warnings: Most snakebites result from stepping on or handling snakes.
Old buildings and caves harbor spiders, scorpions, and other dangerous creatures.
All desert areas have snakes that seek shade during day.
